{{Infobox football biography | playername = Julien Baudet | image = [[Image:Replace this image male.svg]] | fullname = Julien Baudet | dateofbirth = {{birth date and age|1979|1|13}} | cityofbirth = [[Grenoble]] | countryofbirth = [[France]] | height = {{convert|6|ft|2|in|abbr=on}} | position = [[Defender (association football)|Defender]] | currentclub = AC Seyssinet ([[Coach (sport)|Manager]]) | clubnumber = | years1 = 1999–2001 | clubs1 = [[Toulouse FC|Toulouse]] | caps1 = 21 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2001–2003 | clubs2 = [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]] | caps2 = 44 | goals2 = 3 | years3 = 2003–2004 | clubs3 = [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]] | caps3 = 11 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2004–2006 | clubs4 = [[Notts County F.C.|Notts County]] | caps4 = 81 | goals4 = 11 | years5 = 2006–2009 | clubs5 = [[Crewe Alexandra F.C.|Crewe Alexandra]] | caps5 = 110 | goals5 = 2 | years6 = 2009–2010 | clubs6 = [[Colorado Rapids]] | caps6 = 28 | goals6 = 1 | nationalyears1 = | nationalteam1 = | nationalcaps1 = | nationalgoals1 = | pcupdate = November 9, 2010 | ntupdate = | manageryears1 = 2011â | managerclubs1 = AC Seyssinet }} '''Julien Baudet''' (born January 13, 1979 in [[Grenoble]]) is a former [[France|French]] [[Association football|footballer]] and current [[Coach (sport)|manager]]. == Club career == === Europe === Although excelling as a [[skier]] in his youth, Baudet chose to concentrate on football, beginning his career with [[Toulouse FC]] in France, where he spent two years, clocking up 21 league appearances. In 2001 Baudet moved to [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]] in the [[Football League Second Division|third tier]] in England on a free transfer. Spending two years at Oldham, he made 44 league appearances, scoring his first goal on 20 April 2002 against [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]]. After a free transfer in summer 2003 to [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]] in the [[Football League First Division|second tier]], Baudet played 11 times in the league before a free transfer to [[Notts County F.C.|Notts County]] in [[Football League Two]], where he spent two seasons as a regular starter and became club captain. In July 2006, Baudet moved on yet another free transfer - to [[Crewe Alexandra F.C.|Crewe Alexandra]] - where he improved his game a great deal under the guidance of [[Steve Holland (footballer)|Steve Holland]] and [[Dario Gradi]], becoming the club captain after the retirement of [[Neil Cox (footballer)|Neil Cox]]. He scored his first goal away at [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle United]], and became quickly became a fans favourite and a vital part of the whole team including defence and attack. He was known as "the beast" by Crewe fans for his strong bustling presence and his contributions to the attack with spectacular long range free-kicks. After being voted the Fans' Player of the Year for the [[2007-08 in English football|2007-08]] season, Baudet commented, with typical understatement, that he was "relatively pleased" with the way he played over the year and that "like all footballers you do have good and bad days, but I think I have been fairly consistent in what has proved to be a disappointing season for the club", referring to Crewe's relegation battle to stay in League One.{{cite news |title=Great Honour For Baudet |url=http://www.crewealex.premiumtv.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10414~1307577,00.html |publisher=[[Crewe Alexandra F.C.]] |date=2008-05-07 |accessdate=2008-05-08 }} === North America === On April 17, 2009, Baudet reported that he would transfer at the end of the 2008-09 season to the [[Colorado Rapids]] of [[Major League Soccer]]. On July 25, 2009 Baudet made his competitive home debut for Colorado Rapids, breaking his arm in the first half after landing awkwardly on it. Baudet received a yellow card for the reckless challenge which resulted in the broken arm. Colorado eventually won the game 4-0 over [[New York Red Bulls]]. Upon his return from injury on August 30, 2009, Baudet came on as a substitute and opened his account with the Rapids, scoring the only goal in a 1-0 win over [[Houston Dynamo]]. After winning the [[MLS Cup]] with Colorado, Baudet was traded to [[Seattle Sounders FC]], along with teammate [[Danny Earls]], on November 22, 2010.{{cite news| url=http://seattletimes.nwsource.com/html/soundersfcblog/2013497325_sounders_fc_trade_vagenas_to_c.html | work=The Seattle Times | first=Joshua | last=Mayers | title=Sounders FC trade Vagenas to Colorado for two defenders | date=November 22, 2010}} === Celtic trial === On 7 February 2011, Baudet featured in a [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]] XI who faced the [[League of Ireland]] team {{fc|Shamrock Rovers}} at the [[Tallaght Stadium]] in [[Dublin]]. He played the full 90 minutes as Celtic ran out 2-0 winners, with goals from [[Daryl Murphy]] and [[Graham Carey]]. == Coaching career == After failing to earn a contract with Celtic, Baudet returned to England and began the process of obtaining a [[UEFA Pro Licence]] in coaching.{{cite news| url=http://www.fff.fr/bleus/actu/539884_baudet-de-vrais-shows-a-l-americaine | work=[[French Football Federation]] | first=Antonio | last=Mesa | title=Baudet: "De vrais shows Ã  l'amÃ©ricaine" | date=4 November 2011 | language = French }} On 19 June 2011, he was named manager of French amateur club AC Seyssinet.{{cite news| url=http://ac-seyssinetfoot.footeo.com/actualite/2011/06/19/un-nouvel-entraineur-pour-l-ac-seyssinet.html | work=AC Seyssinet | title=Un nouvel entraineur pour l'AC Seyssinet | date=19 June 2011 | language = French }} The club currently plays in the Division d'Honneur RÃ©gionale, the seventh division of French football. ==Honours== ===Colorado Rapids=== *'''[[Major League Soccer]] Eastern Conference Championship (1):''' [[2010 Major League Soccer season|2010]] *'''[[Major League Soccer]] MLS Cup (1):''' [[2010 Major League Soccer season|2010]] ==See also== * [[List of current MLS players]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.mlssoccer.com/players/julien-baudet MLS player profile] *{{soccerbase|28759|Julien Baudet}} *[http://www.crewealex.net/page/ProfilesDetail/0,,10414~21765,00.html Profile on Crewe's official website] {{s-start}} {{s-ach|aw}} {{succession box| before = [[Luke Varney]] | title = [[Crewe Alexandra F.C.]]
Fans' Player of the Year | after = [[John Brayford]] | years = [[2007-08 in English football|2007-08]]}} {{s-end}} {{Persondata | NAME = Baudet, Julien | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = January 13, 1979 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Grenoble]], [[France]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Baudet, Julien}} [[Category:1979 births]] [[Category:People from Grenoble]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Association football defenders]] [[Category:French footballers]] [[Category:French expatriate footballers]] [[Category:Toulouse FC players]] [[Category:Oldham Athletic A.F.C. players]] [[Category:Rotherham United F.C. players]] [[Category:Notts County F.C. players]] [[Category:Crewe Alexandra F.C. players]] [[Category:Colorado Rapids players]] [[Category:Ligue 1 players]] [[Category:The Football League players]] [[Category:Expatriate footballers in England]] [[Category:French football managers]] [[fr:Julien Baudet]] [[it:Julien Baudet]]
